Simulate color vision deficiency

Source: R/palettes.R
show_cvd.Rd

Simulate color(s) to check how people with different variations of colorblindness may perceive your visualization. Supported variations include deuteranopia, protanopia, tritanopia, and grayscale.

Usage

show_cvd(x)

Arguments

x

A color, a vector of colors, or a color palette.

Value

A plot showing selected color or colors in different color deficiency simulations.

Examples

x <- c("steelblue", "firebrick", "gold")
show_cvd(x)
